japanese: （ああ、風が気持ちいい……）
translation: (Ah, the wind feels so good...)

japanese:
（あんなに泳いだのはいつぶりだったか。
　水泳なんて、そうそうやる機会がないからな）
translation:
(When was the last time I was swimming like that.
 I don't have that many opportunities to swim
 in the first place.)

japanese:
（たまには思いっきり体を動かすのも悪くない。
　勉強の合間の息抜きに……
　いや、それで疲れてしまうのは問題外か……）
translation:
(It's not bad to move your body a lot once in a while.
 Even if it's just to take a break from studying...
 yet, there's no way I'd get tired from that...)

japanese:
フー君？
空を見上げて、どうしたのよ。
translation:
Fu-kun?
Why are you looking at the sky?

japanese:
ああ、いや、泳ぎ疲れたし
休憩ついでに少し考え事をな。
translation:
Ahh, well, I got tired from swimming,
so I was taking a break and started thinking.

japanese: 勉強のことじゃないでしょうね？
translation: Thinking about studying, huh?

japanese: ……ノーコメントだ。
translation: ...No comment.

japanese:
もう、今日と明日は勉強から離れなさいよね。
フー君には無理かもしれないけど。
translation:
Oh come on, stop thinking about studying
for now.
Although that might be impossible for you, Fu-kun.

japanese: 努力する……。
translation: I'll do my best...

japanese:
何もしてないから余計なこと考えちゃうのよ。
ほら、一緒に砂遊びでもしない？
translation:
You're thinking too much because you have nothing
to do. Come on, wanna play in the sand with me?

japanese:
またか？
お前、好きなんだな。
translation:
Again?
You really like that, huh.

japanese:
砂遊び？
また、ずいぶんと子どもらしい遊びを選ぶんだな。
translation:
Playing in the sand?
Yet again, you choose a pretty childish way to play.

japanese:
いいじゃない。
こんなときくらいしかできないんだから。
translation:
But that's fine, right?
Now is the only time I can do that.

japanese:
それに、いつもとは違う時間を楽しむために
別荘まで来たんでしょ？
translation:
Also, you came all the way to our villa
to enjoy summer in a different way, right?

japanese:
言われてみりゃそうだな。
いいぜ、何を作るんだ？
translation:
Sure, when you put it like that.
Ok, what do you wanna make?

japanese:
やっぱりお城ね！
大きくて、おとぎ話に出てくるようなものを
作りましょ！
translation:
It's gotta be a sandcastle!
Let's make something big,
as if it's out of a fairy tale!

japanese:
おとぎ話か。
となると、立派にしないとな。
translation:
Out of a fairy tale, eh.
We've got to build a fantastic one.

japanese:
お姫様がいるようなお城がいいわ。
きっと塔のてっぺんの部屋に住んでいるのよ。
translation:
I want to make a castle were a princess could be 
residing. She'd definitely live in the room at the top 
of a tower.

japanese:
夜になると、ガラスでできた天井から
月と星の光が降り注いで……。
translation:
At night,
the moon and stars
shine through the glass ceiling...

japanese: それ、昼間は暑くてたまらないだろ。
translation: That'll get unbearably hot during the daytime.

japanese:
……昼間は閉まってるのよ。
天井が動くの、きっとそうよ。
translation:
...The ceiling would be closed during the day.
And the ceiling would definitely be able to move.

japanese: となると動力が謎だな。
translation: How do you power the ceiling?

japanese:
もー！
動力なんてどうでもいいじゃない、
おとぎ話なんだから！
translation:
Oh, give me a BREAK!
Who cares about how it's powered?!
It's a fairy tale!

japanese: す、すまん……。
translation: M-my bad...

japanese:
しかし、お前って結構、
そういう夢見てるところあるよな。
translation: Yet, you are really fantasizing about that, huh.

japanese:
ホント、未だにわかってないのね。
女の子はいつだってお姫様なの。
translation:
You really don't get it, huh.
ALL girls are princesses.

japanese:
誰もがみんな、
いつか迎えに来てくれる自分だけの王子様を
待ってるんだから。
translation:
Every girl is waiting for her very own prince
to come and save her someday.

japanese:
中には、捕まえに行かなきゃのらりくらりと
逃げちゃう王子様もいるけど。
translation:
Among those, there are some princes
who try to avoid the princess,
and run away.

japanese: たとえば、私の目の前にいる男の子とかね。
translation: For example, like the man in front of me.

japanese: それは、もしかしなくても俺のことか。
translation: Do you perchance mean me?

japanese:
覚えがあるなら、胸に手を当てて
考えてみたらいいんじゃないかしら？
translation:
If you think you might know,
why don't you take your time and think about it?

japanese:
王子の定義を考え直せ。
少なくとも、俺は王子なんて柄じゃない。
translation:
You should rethink how you define a prince.
I am not a prince at all.

japanese:
フー君に心配されなくても、
私の中ではちゃんと決まってるもの。
ちゃーんと、ね。
translation:
You needn't worry about it, Fu-kun,
as it's something I already decided.
Firmly decided.

japanese:
……ねえ、私にとっての王子様が
どんな人か知りたい？　知りたいかしら？
translation:
...Hey, wanna hear about
what kind of person my prince is?
Do you wanna know?

japanese: いや、止めとく。
translation: Nah, I'm good.

japanese: なんでよ！
translation: Why?!

japanese: 興味ないからな。
translation: Cause I'm not really interested.

japanese:
（そんなもの聞いたら……
　こいつの顔が見れなくなってしまいそうだ）
translation:
(If I ask her that...
 I feel like I won't be able
 to look her in the eye anymore.)

japanese:
（……しまった。
　変な話を振ってしまったせいで
　妙な雰囲気になっちまってないか？）
translation:
(...Oh no.
 Have I caused her mood to go south
 because I said something weird?)

japanese:
俺にはわからないな。
王子なんて、あまりに非現実的だ。
translation:
I have no idea.
Princes are way too uncommon.

japanese:
男の子はそれでいいのよ。
王子様は、女の子が見つけるものなんだから。
自分だけの、ただ１人の王子様を。
translation:
That's fine for boys.
If a girl finds her prince she'll lash onto him. For a 
girl there only exists one prince on this planet.

japanese:
でもね、王子様もお姫様を捜しているの。
自分だけのお姫様を。
translation:
But, the prince is also looking for a princess.
A princess all for his own.

japanese:
この辺が難しいところよね。
お互いがお互いを見つけることができたら
いいんだけど……。
translation:
But this is the hard part.
It would be so nice
if they could find each other...

japanese: そう上手くいかないところが、本当に難しいわ。
translation:
It's just so painful,
when things don't work out.

japanese:
気付いていなかったり、
気持ちがすれ違っちゃったり、
出会えても、お互いわからなかったり……。
translation:
They may not be aware of their feelings when they 
pass each other. Even if they meet, they may not
understand each other...

japanese:
（……しまった。
　変な話を振ってしまったせいで
　妙な雰囲気になっちまってないか？）
translation:
(...Oh no.
 Have I caused her mood to go south
 because I said something weird?)

japanese:
どうかしてる。
王子様なんているわけないだろ。
translation:
You're nuts.
There's no prince.

japanese:
ふふ、そうね。
どうかしてるかもしれない。
translation:
Teehee, you're right.
I might be nuts.

japanese:
でも……どうかなっちゃうのよ。
恋をすると。
translation:
But...it'll work out.
If I fall in love, I'll make it work.

japanese:
フー君も恋をすればわかるわよ。
理屈じゃないの、好きって気持ちは。
translation:
You'll get it, if you fall in love too, Fu-kun.
The feeling of love can't be logically explained.

japanese:
……確かに理屈じゃないだろうな。
きっかけが何かなんて、
なってみなけりゃわからないもんだ。
translation:
...It's certainly not logical.
You won't know what triggers the feeling
until you experience it.

japanese: まったくだわ。
translation: Exactly.

japanese:
あの人にとっての唯一が私であればいい。
あの人が私のものになればいい。
そんな風に思っちゃう日が来るなんてね。
translation:
I wish I'll be the only one for that person.
And I want that person to be mine. I can't believe 
that this day will come someday.

japanese:
（……しまった。
　変な話を振ってしまったせいで
　妙な雰囲気になっちまってないか？）
translation:
(...Oh no.
 Have I caused her mood to go south
 because I said something weird?)

japanese:
よ、よーし、城を作ろう！
どうせ作るなら、より精密に、より完ぺきにだ！
まずは水をくんでくるぞ！
translation:
A-alright, let's make that castle!
If we're gonna make it, let's make it more precise,
more accurate! I'll fetch you some water first!

japanese: 水？　海水でいいの？
translation: Water? Is sea water good?

japanese:
砂で大きなものを作るときは、
土台を固めてやらないとそこから崩れちまう。
translation:
When you're making something big out of sand,
you have to solidify the foundation
or it'll collapse.

japanese:
海水で適度に湿らせて固め、
少しずつ細かい場所を彫っていくんだ。
translation:
You moisten it with seawater to harden it,
and then you have to carve out small areas 
little by little.

japanese:
へえ、そうなの。
知らなかった。
translation:
Huh, wow.
I didn't know that.

japanese:
あ、そういえば時々、砂で作った大きな像が
紹介されてることがあるけど、そんな風に作るのね。
translation:
Sometimes you see these big sand statues. 
But, I didn't know this was how they were made.

japanese:
屋根はどんな形がいいんだ？
アラビアン系の下が膨らんだようなやつとか。
translation:
What shape should the roof be?
Like an Arabian one with a bulging roof?

japanese:
んー、それよりは欧風ね。
屋根が三角になっているものがいいわ。
translation:
Hmm, let's make it more European.
I want something with a triangular roof.

japanese:
わかった、任せろ。
立派な城を作ってやる。
translation:
Got it, leave it to me.
I'll build you a fantastic castle.

japanese:
……そういえば、
フー君には憧れてるものってないの？
将来なりたいものとか。
translation:
...Hmm, is there something that you're longing 
to become, Fu-kun?
Something you'd like to be doing in the future?

japanese: 特にない。
translation: Not really.

japanese: 即答！？
translation: Your reply was way too FAST!

japanese:
まあ、強いてあげるなら、
俺の武器である勉強を活かせる職業だ。
給料がよければ、なおいい。
translation:
Well, if you're going to force an answer,
I'd like to use my studying ability for my professional
career. And if I can get a good salary, even better.

japanese:
身も蓋もないわねぇ。
もう少し夢はないの、夢は。
translation:
You're so blunt, aren't you.
Don't you have any big dreams?

japanese:
夢で飯は食えないからな。
らいはにも苦労させちまってるから、
早く楽をさせてやりたい。
translation:
Dreams can't buy food.
Raiha's taking care of so much,
and I'd like to relieve her of her burden.

japanese:
……その気持ちはわかるわ。
いい子よね、らいはちゃんって。
translation:
...I understand how you feel.
Raiha-chan's such a good girl.

japanese: あんな妹がいたらいいのになぁ～。
translation: I wish I had a little sister like that.

japanese: やらんぞ。
translation: I won't hand her over.

japanese: ……そもそもフー君のものじゃないでしょ。
translation:
...Well, she's not yours to give
in the first place.

japanese:
うーん？
どうも、ここの部分がうまくいかないな。
もう少し砂を追加してみるか。
translation:
Hmm?
This part is giving us a little trouble.
Let's try adding a little more sand.

japanese:
おっ、いい感じになってきたぞ！
あとは全体的に肉付けをして……。
translation:
Oh, it's starting to look pretty good!
Then, we can flesh out the whole structure...

japanese: ２人とも、なにしてるの？
translation: What are you two doing?

japanese:
お城を作ってたんだけど……
フー君が予想外に熱中しちゃってて。
translation:
We were making a sand castle...
but Fu-kun got overenthusiastic.

japanese:
へえ、立派だね。
砂でここまでできるんだ。
translation:
Wow, it's majestic.
You can build a lot out of sand.

japanese:
まだまだだ！
適度に湿らせてそのまま乾かせば、
細かい模様や飾りを描くことができる。
translation:
I'm not done yet!
If I moisten it and let it dry,
I can draw fine patterns and decorations.

japanese: ここからディティールアップだ！
translation: Now, it's time to up the detail!

japanese:
そ、そう。
変にテンション高いね、フータロー君。
translation:
Y-you're right.
Futaro-kun is strangely excited.

japanese:
私も、いつかフー君と
こんなお城に行ってみたいなぁ。
translation: I'd like to go to this castle with you someday, Fu-kun.

japanese:
ドイツに有名なお城があるのよ。
貸し切りにして泊まることもできるの。
translation:
There's a famous castle in Germany.
We can rent it out for the day.

japanese:
二乃はドイツ風が好みなのか？
それなら、ここはこうして……。
translation:
Do you like German style things, Nino?
In that case, let me do this...

japanese:
あー、えっと！
フータロー君は行きたい場所とかない？
国内でもいいし、海外でもいいよ？
translation:
Ah, um!
Isn't there a place where you want to go, Futaro-kun?
Either in Japan or overseas?

japanese:
今はないな。
受験生が旅行なんて考えてる場合じゃない。
translation:
Nope.
I don't have any time to think about that,
I need to study for the entrance exams, ya know.

japanese:
いや、今すぐじゃなくてもいいんだって。
一生に一度は見ておきたい光景とか、あるでしょ？
translation:
No, I didn't mean like right now.
There's got to be a landscape
you'd love to see at least once in your life, right?

japanese: ……よし、できたぞ！
translation: ...Oh, right!

japanese: え？
translation: Huh?

japanese:
くっくっく、どうだ？
我ながら見事な仕上がりだ！
translation:
Ehehehe, how do you think about that?
A spectacular creation, if I do say so myself!

japanese: あ、お城？
translation: Ah, you mean the castle?

japanese:
他に何がある。
どうだ二乃、ご希望の塔もつけてやったぞ！
translation:
There's something else, too.
Behold, Nino! I attached the tower you wanted!

japanese:
確かにいい出来映えだわ。
フー君、やるわね。
translation:
That is a beautifully crafted tower.
Fu-kun, you're really skilled.

japanese:
あ、そうだ！
せっかくだし写真撮ってあげるよ！
ほら、お城の近くで並んで並んで。
translation:
Ah, that's right!
Let's take a picture!
Come on over to the castle.

japanese:
そうね！
フー君が私のために作ってくれたんだもの。
記念に残しておかなくちゃ。
translation:
Good idea!
Fu-kun made it for me.
We've got to keep a souvenir.

japanese:
はーい、じゃあこっち見てねー。
いくよー。
translation:
Alright, look over here, now-.
Here we goooo.

japanese: ああっ！！
translation: Aaah!!

japanese: お城が波に……。
translation: The waves hit the castle...

japanese:
そっか、もう潮が満ちる時間か。
すっかり忘れてた……。
translation:
Ah, it's already time for the tide to come in.
I completely forgot...

japanese: 俺の大作が……海の藻屑に……。
translation: My masterpiece...is meeting its watery grave...

japanese: な、なんか、ごめんね？
translation: I-I'm kinda, sorry?

japanese:
いや、お前は悪くない……。
しかし、あれだけのものはもう作れる気がしない……。
translation:
No, you didn't do anything...
But, I don't think I can make anything like that
anymore...

japanese:
せめて写真だけでも撮っておきたかった！
らいはに見せてやりたかった！！
translation:
I at least wanted to take a picture!
I wanted to show it to Raiha!!

japanese: ……はあ。
translation: *sigh*

japanese:
フー君、元気出して？
またお城一緒に作りましょ？
translation:
Fu-kun, cheer up, okay?
We can build another castle, okay?

japanese:
こうして海に遊びに来るの、
今回で最後ってわけじゃないんだもの。
translation: We'll be visiting the beach to play in the sand again.

japanese: そうだな……。
translation: That's right...

japanese:
（今度は、まず撮影しよう。
　油断するんじゃないぞ、俺！）
translation:
(I'll take a picture of it right off the bat next time.
 Come on, Futaro! Don't be careless)
